name: CoffeeShop
description: My first project for BrainStation. Just HTML (BEM for the class names) and CSS (Sass).

name: TravelSite
description: My second project for BrainStation. Same deal as my Coffee Shop website: HTML (BEM) + CSS (Sass).

name: BandSite
description: My third BrainStation project and the first application of JavaScript in a website for me. All DOM methods - no frontend frameworks used for this.

name: PokeMart
description: My first hackathon for BrainStation. The only requirement was that we use an API. This frontend application connects to the pokeAPI and uses its data to make a little poke-store.

name: BrainFlix
description: My first full stack project. React client and Express backend. Slow startup (hosted for free on Heroku).

name: East Vancouver Radio
description: My final project for BrainStation. This full stack application is hosted on Heroku for free: mind the slow startup and refresh the page if you need. This application consists of an Express server streaming music to a React client and if you also have the user/password combo you can upload or delete mp3s from the client-side. There's also a chat application handled by MongoDB and socket.io - feel free to say a "hello" in the chat!

name: InStock
description: This is a full stack TypeScript project created with React, Express & Knex (connected to a MySQL database). Warning: sloooow startup.

name: DevJobs
description: Frontend React Typescript application (using fake data). Mind the slow startup but make sure to check out the light & dark modes, as well as the responsive layout.

name: Shortly
description: Frontend React Typescript application connected to a URL shortening API. Made with styled-components.
